overview: Gene Savchuk has been in the computer and networking industry for 15 years, first managing networks and then moving to developing commercial network security and management solutions. His first network systems administration program went to market in 1992. In 1995, a remote user authentication solution that he developed was introduced to European markets. Prior to co-founding Fidelis Security Systems, Inc., he served as Director of Software Development at InforMax Inc. and helped to guide it from a startup to a public company with almost 300 employees. At Fidelis, he has been the primary architect and has led the development of Fidelis XPS. Mr. Savchuk holds a Bachelors Degree in Physics and Applied Mathematics and a Master of Computer Science.
